title: update FAQ, the Debian packages and distribution work just fine and are reccomendable for server environments
body:
After testing the only other architecture that Ubuntu did not support but debian did, gnu hurd packages work just fine and are.
A similarly packaged debian installation could be supported by adding a section that explains modifying the sources.list file to replace the debian package repositories with the ones provided by debian, specifically the packages in testing as it fully replaces the files and directories and yet still works.
TL:DR Ubuntu 16.04TLS is an OK basis, but a full debian replacement via sources.list modification to include only debian stretch release packages is possible and possibly recommendable
